content:
UnicodeEncodingConformance Enum

Definition

Controls how Unicode characters are output by the stem.Net.WebUtility.HtmlEncode* methods.

In this Article

public enum UnicodeEncodingConformance
Inheritance
Object
ValueType
System.Enum
UnicodeEncodingConformance

Remarks

For more information on how Unicode characters are supposed to be encoded in HTML, see Using character escapes in markup and CSS.

Fields

Auto

Use automatic behavior. The Unicode encoding behavior is determined by current application's target Framework. For .NET Framework 4.5 and later, the Unicode encoding behavior is strict.
Compat

Use compatible behavior. Specifies that individual UTF-16 surrogate code points are output as-is when one of stem.Net.WebUtility.HtmlEncode* methods is called. For example, given a string "\uD84C\uDFB4" (or "\U000233B4"), the output of stem.Net.WebUtility.HtmlEncode* is "\uD84C\uDFB4" (the input is not encoded).
Strict

Use strict behavior. Specifies that individual UTF-16 surrogate code points are combined into a single code point when one of the stem.Net.WebUtility.HtmlEncode* methods is called. For example, given the input string "\uD84C\uDFB4" (or "\U000233B4"), the output of the stem.Net.WebUtility.HtmlEncode* methods is "𣎴".

If the input is a malformed UTF-16 string (it contains unpaired surrogates, for example), the bad code points will be replaced with U+FFFD (Unicode replacement char) before being HTML-encoded.
